```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(here)

theme_set(theme_minimal())

```

## Exercise 1

```{r}
dates <- tribble(
  ~date,
  "12/01/1987",
  "12/02/1987",
  "12/03/1987"
)

dates %>%
  mutate(date = mdy(date))

```

## Exercise 2

```{r}
# https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/UNRATE
# accessed on 2021-11-19
u3_rate <- read_csv(here("data", "UNRATE.csv"))

# https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/U6RATE
# accessed on 2021-11-19
u6_rate <- read_csv(here("data", "U6RATE.csv"))

# combine the U3 and U6 data
rates <- left_join(u3_rate, u6_rate, by = "DATE")

rates %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_line(aes(DATE, UNRATE), color = "blue") +
  geom_line(aes(DATE, U6RATE), color = "red")

```

   2018-09-27,0.0225,0.02
   2018-12-20,0.025,0.0225
   2019-08-01,0.0225,0.02
   2019-09-19,0.02,0.0175
   2019-10-31,0.0175,0.015
   2020-03-03,0.0125,0.01
   2020-03-15,0.0025,0
   2022-03-16,0.005,0.0025
   2022-05-04,0.01,0.0075
   2022-06-15,0.0175,0.015
   2022-07-27,0.025,0.0225
   2022-09-21,0.0325,0.03

fed_funds_rate %>%

## Exercise 4

```{r}
# https://fredhelp.stlouisfed.org/fred/data/understanding-the-data/recession-bars/
# downloaded from FRED on 2021-11-19

recessions <- read_csv(
  "Peak, Trough
   1857-06-01, 1858-12-01
   1860-10-01, 1861-06-01
   1865-04-01, 1867-12-01
   1869-06-01, 1870-12-01
   1873-10-01, 1879-03-01
   1882-03-01, 1885-05-01
   1887-03-01, 1888-04-01
   1890-07-01, 1891-05-01
   1893-01-01, 1894-06-01
   1895-12-01, 1897-06-01
   1899-06-01, 1900-12-01
   1902-09-01, 1904-08-01
   1907-05-01, 1908-06-01
   1910-01-01, 1912-01-01
   1913-01-01, 1914-12-01
   1918-08-01, 1919-03-01
   1920-01-01, 1921-07-01
   1923-05-01, 1924-07-01
   1926-10-01, 1927-11-01
   1929-08-01, 1933-03-01
   1937-05-01, 1938-06-01
   1945-02-01, 1945-10-01
   1948-11-01, 1949-10-01
   1953-07-01, 1954-05-01
   1957-08-01, 1958-04-01
   1960-04-01, 1961-02-01
   1969-12-01, 1970-11-01
   1973-11-01, 1975-03-01
   1980-01-01, 1980-07-01
   1981-07-01, 1982-11-01
   1990-07-01, 1991-03-01
   2001-03-01, 2001-11-01
   2007-12-01, 2009-06-01
   2020-02-01, 2020-04-01")

rates %>%
  mutate(UNRATE = UNRATE / 100) %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_line(aes(DATE, UNRATE)) +
  geom_rect(
    data = filter(recessions, Peak >= "1950-01-01"),
    aes(xmin = Peak, xmax = Trough, ymin = 0, ymax = 0.2), 
    alpha = 0.3
  ) + 
  scale_y_continuous(
    limits = c(0, NA),
    labels = scales::percent_format(accuracy = 1)
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "Unemployment Reached Record Highs After COVID-19 Emerged",
    subtitle = "",
    x = "Date",
    y = "Unemployment Rate",
    caption = "Source: Bureau of Labor Statistics data accessed through FRED"
  ) +
  annotate(geom = "text", x = date("2020-01-01"), y = 0.17, label = "Covid-19\nPandemic")

```

## Exercise 6

```{r}
# https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/PAYEMS
# accessed on 2021-11-19

payrolls <- read_csv(here("day03", "data", "PAYEMS.csv")) %>%
  mutate(PAYEMS = PAYEMS / 1000)

# filter to pre-pandemic data for model estimation
payrolls_pre_pandemic <- payrolls %>%
  filter(DATE < "2020-03-31")

# fit a simple linear regression model with DATE as the predictor
pre_pandemic_trend <- lm(PAYEMS ~ DATE, data = payrolls_pre_pandemic)

# extract coefficients
pre_pandemic_coefs <- coef(pre_pandemic_trend)

# filter to recent data for model estimation
payrolls_2021 <- payrolls %>%
  filter(DATE >= "2021-01-01")

# fit a simple linear regression model with DATE as the predictor
trend_2021 <- lm(PAYEMS ~ DATE, data = payrolls_2021)

# extract coefficients
coefs_2021 <- coef(trend_2021)

# plot
ggplot() +
  geom_line(
    data = payrolls,
    aes(DATE, PAYEMS)
  ) +
  geom_abline(
    intercept = pre_pandemic_coefs["(Intercept)"], 
    slope = pre_pandemic_coefs["DATE"],
    linetype = "dashed"
  ) +
  geom_abline(
    intercept = coefs_2021["(Intercept)"], 
    slope = coefs_2021["DATE"],
    linetype = "dashed"
  ) +
  scale_x_date(limits = c(as_date(NA), as_date("2025-01-01"))) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(NA, 160))

```

## Exercise 7

```{r}
remote <- read_csv(here("day03", "data", "remote-work.csv"))

labels <- remote %>%
  slice_max(date) %>%
  mutate(date = date + months(6))

remote %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = remote_prop, color = major_occ)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point() +
  geom_text(
    data = labels,
    aes(label = major_occ)
  ) +
  scale_x_date(limits = c(as_date(NA), as_date("2023-06-01"))) +
  labs(
    title = "Remote Work in the Pandemic, by Occupation",
    subtitle = "Persons teleworking because of the pandemic, as share of employed",
    caption = "Source: Bureau of Labor Statistics (via IPUMS)"
  ) +
  guides(color = "none")

```
